title: BBC News
text:
Getty Images

Here's an interesting report from the FT: the paper says a senior economist at UBS who was suspended after making controversial remarks relating to a bout of swine fever in China is returning to work.

Paul Donovan, chief economist at UBS Global Wealth Management, was put on leave in June after he said that the outbreak of the disease only “matters if you are a Chinese pig” or “if you like eating pork in China”.

A spokesperson for UBS told the paper that Mr Donovan was scheduled to return to work on Wednesday.
